caseTitle: DENICO ENGINEERING LTD. v. BIG AIDOO CONSTRUCTION LTD.
summary: In Denico Engineering Ltd. v. Big Aido Construction Ltd., the Court of Appeal reviewed the trial judge's award of ₵20,000,000 in general and special damages, finding that only the special damages based on the hire agreement (Exhibit ‘B’) were justified. The court held that the hire rate of ₵40,000 per day constituted liquidated damages, and calculated the rightful award for the period from February to May 1988 as ₵4,320,000, adding to the previously accepted ₵7,127,000 for June–December 1988, totaling ₵11,457,000. The court set aside the general damages due to lack of evidentiary basis and awarded interest on the outstanding amount under LI 1295, recognizing the plaintiff’s right to the use of money wrongfully withheld.
verdict: Appeal allowed in part; damages award revised
citations: Halsbury's Laws of England, 4th Ed., Vol.12, para.1116 @ 419
Harbutt’s Plastiscine vrs: Wayne Tank Ltd. (1970) 1 All ER 225 @ 236
London Chatham & Dover Rly. Co. vrs: South Eastern Rly. Co. (1893) AC 429 @ 439
rationaleHighlights: The hire rate of ₵40,000/day under Exhibit ‘B’ constitutes a pre-estimated liquidated damages clause.
Termination of the hire agreement is factually determined by return of equipment, not by default clauses.
Special damages are recoverable as lost earnings under the contract; general damages require separate wrongful acts.
No evidence supported general damages; thus, they were set aside.
Interest awarded under LI 1295 due to wrongful withholding of money owed.
